text: Ivo Hélcio Jardim de Campos Pitanguy (July 5, 1926 – August 6, 2016) was a Brazilian plastic surgeon. He was born in Belo Horizonte. In 1953, he began working at a Brazilian hospital. On December 17, 1961, a burning circus tent fell on 2,500 spectators in the Brazilian city of Niterói. Pitanguy treated burn victims for weeks on an emergency basis. He later referred to the event as life changing, as it taught him that for many, physical appearance was critical to living. Pitanguy died of a heart attack at his home in Rio de Janeiro on 6 August 2016, aged 90.Celebrated Brazil plastic surgeon Ivo Pitanguy dies at 90 == References == == Other websites== * Ivo Pitanguy Clinic Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Surgeons Category:Brazilian physicians Category:People from Belo Horizonte Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction
